author: Jorge Proença
comment: It's not downloading my subscriptions

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi Jorge, if your subscriptions are not downloading it can be that your auto-download is off or it has reached the download limit. This can easily be fixed by going to Settings | Downloads. Enable auto-download or increase the number on your download settings. If you need further assistance, please mail support@player.fm

author: Tavares Malone
comment: Great app!

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks, Tavares! Please don't hesitate to email us at support@player.fm should you need further assistance or have suggestions for improvement.

author: Ewan S
comment: Moving from one star to two. All the new stuff is very pretty but sadly its too unreliable. 3 podcasts not updating today, but are fine in my backup app. The fact I need a backup app on my phone shows this is not an isolated incident

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi Ewan, most of the feeds have been fixed today and should be working well on the app again. Can you please check and confirm. You can mail support@player.fm if you are still having issues on certain feeds.

author: Ben Hutchinson
comment: Have used this app for a year with no problems. Last week or so half my feeds have not been synchronising properly. Switching to another podcast app until they fix it

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi Ben, sorry about that. There were feed issues last week however it's been fixed and latest episodes are ensured to appear on the podcasts. Please check your podcasts again and feel free to mail support@player.fm if you need further assistance.

author: Adrienne Feenstra
comment: This app has worked well for a while, but I realized that every once in a while it will just not load all of the episodes of a podcast. It likes to cut out chunks of sometimes up to a hundred episodes of a podcast at a time, right out of the middle, and keep them unavailable for weeks. No amount of restarting ir wifi fiddling has fixed this. They just come and go. I'm afraid I must try new apps, because I simply cannot listen to my podcasts here.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi Adrienne, it's not a normal behaviour of the app. We'd like to assist you in getting the cause of this. We can check the feed and your settings if you can send us a report via the app's Settings | Help | Contact Us and make sure to tick logs so we can investigate this further.

author: David Getz
comment: Terrible. About 1 out of 10 uses results in my note 8 overheating and draining the battery in 2-3 hours. I can use any other player for 30+ hours and they don't turn my phone into a hand warmer.  It appears they are aware of issues. I hope they are resolved soon. Just don't fall asleep without terminating the app manually, it's otherwise a good app. System warns of battery drain caused by player FM generally when the app is not playing sound and is closed but still running in background (often when sleep after episode is used)  Tried to send logs, but I'm unsure if they went through.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi David, I understand your point about terminating the app, that's generally what happens (e.g. we tested today and found only 1% drain including syncs) but it seems to be something vendor or OS specific that we're trying to track down via logs. Would be super-grateful if you can send logs as we didn't receive them Thanks!

author: Max Tolan
comment: Terribly. Very buggy. I wanted to like it, but had to delete it

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi Max, why did you mention buggy? It would help us determine the issue if you can provide more info. Every release includes bug fixes plus it goes through thorough testing.

author: Ernest Chung
comment: The app is mostly fine, but the skip episode setup is a bit wonky. I find that I have to hit previous track to play the downloaded episodes I have.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi Ernest, why did you mention the skip episode is wonky? We'd like to check this further with you. Can you please mail support@player.fm with more details and also please send us logs. Playing downloaded episodes should be much smoother since the episodes are already on your device.

author: Josh Kruse
comment: Really janky app, for a long time have had issues downloading episodes, when trying to download on cellular it's almost impossible

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi Josh - Download issues have various causes, i.e. unstable internet/mobile connection, slow response of the publisher's server, inaccessible episode files. We can further investigate this for you if you send logs in Settings | Help | [Contact us]. We look forward to receiving your report, and hope to address your concern soon.

author: David Parker
comment: Updated today and now the Chromecast option is gone. Was using this for over a year but if this function has been removed will move onto another program.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: David, I'm sorry, but that's completely untrue.. Chromecast continues to work as before and is available from the 3-dot menu on the mini player or to of the full screen as before. Make sure your are connected on the same network and confirm you see the icon in other apps as you'll see it here too.

author: Darrell Calhoun
comment: Great app only hang up it freezes forward the end of the podcast for some reason

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi Darrell. The app shouldn't behave in the way you describe and it should definitely play episodes from the beginning to the end without errors. Can you please send us logs (Settings | Help | Contact us) and tick "Logs," as well as share examples of such podcasts, so that we can investigate?

author: E. Simon Williams
comment: I can listen to the things I want to.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks a lot, E. Simon! We're glad to know you're able to listen to your fave podcasts with our app.

author: Robbie Kieffer
comment: Updated review. Promptly fixed and I've reinstalled. There are other players but I like this one the best.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Great to have you back, Robbie. Thanks for updating your review!

author: Ben Rose
comment: Latest update removed all my shows. Thanks guys!

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi Ben, no shows have removed - you can verify that fit yourself on the website or catalogue. Please contact support as it's probably an issue with your connection. We can fix it for you.

author: Julias H
comment: Does all the things, and great widget.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks for the nice feedback, Julias!

author: Jason Shaffer
comment: This wirks great for listening to TALK IS JERICHO

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: We're happy to know our app works for you, Jason. Thanks much!

author: Gaus Golam
comment: So I will be able to used the app

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks for the perfect rating, Gaus!

author: Michelle P
comment: Easy to find new podcasts. Easy and intuitive UX.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks for the nice feedback on the app's interface, Michelle! We're glad you liked it.

author: Sudha in Interstellar
comment: this great podcast player

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks for the 5 stars, Sudha!

author: Scott Whitmore
comment: I've been using it for awhile and it's been good. Unfortunately I've just realised that in the last 8hrs, 30% of my battery usage is PlayerFM. I haven't even used it today...   The Android Wear app could use some attention too. It's would be great if it were more consistent with the app UI. I can never seem to find the latest podcasts to watch on there.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Sorry to hear that, Scott. The app shouldn't consume too much battery unless you stream a lot of content. Other possible causes are stated here: goo.gl/RDz3Bk. Can you pls. go to Settings | Help | [Contact us] and send logs so we can further investigate? We'd also like to know more on your Android Wear issue (i.e. what are you seeing on your end?).

author: Bailey Uniacke
comment: I love the layout of the app, and the ability to stream or download, and no ads, but I'd like there to be a subscriber count so I can see how popular my favourite channels are  EDIT: as of late February, my phone keeps giving me a pop up saying Player FM keeps stopping, even if it's not on or in the background. It also crashes every time I open the app.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks for the compliments, Bailey! The subscription count has already been added, and you can see it on every podcast's screen. Meanwhile, we're sorry for the issues you're having. If it's possible for you to send logs by going to Settings | Help | [Contact us], we hope you could do so. Please keep us posted. Cheers.

author: Nanci Brown
comment: Nice app, like the offline features.  One annoying aspect - if I pause a podcast, it will often start playing spontaneously at a later point. Weird.  Update: I've had this player for about a year and have never been able to resolve this issue. It happens at least once a day. Time to try a new player.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks for letting us know, Nanci. That is indeed weird. Can you please send your logs by going to the app's menu | Help | Contact Us. We will check what caused that.

author: Roy Gardner
comment: This app is essential if you use Sonos speakers. I had grown accustomed to the iOS podcast functionality and had no idea that my experience could be so much better. I love that the app allows you to stream episodes via Sonos app without needing to download. The playback is great too. I've had no dropping our restart issues that I often experienced with the iOS app.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks for the 5 stars and compliments, Roy! We're happy to know our app works well for you, and that it provides you a better podcast listening experience.

author: Daniel Hicken
comment: Ever since January the app freezes on load. Crashes. Takes about three launches to be usable. Even then, it hiccups along, playing about twenty seconds of audio before pausing for five to ten seconds before finally playing again.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi Daniel, sorry about this, we've discovered the probably due to a change in Android battery management which affects some devices. A fix for now is open your device Settings | Battery usage | Player FM | Launch then disable [Manage automatically] and enable [Run in background], this should fix it for you.

comment: Great app for playing my favorite podcasts. One problem: after disconnecting  and reconnecting my Bluetooth headphones the app jumps through the remainder of the podcast in big steps without actually playing it. I have to remember the point I paused listening myself and rewind to that point to start listening again.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks for the nice words and sorry about the inconvenience. What you just described is not a normal app behavior. Can you pls send us your logs (Settings | Help | Contact us and tick "Logs", so that our team can investigate and address your concern?

author: gwen phil
comment: Loved this app till it began stuttering. Then I was about to ditch it - but the Support was both instant and successful. Now I love it again. Can't praise the Support enough!  So why haven't I given five stars? Because it's still very tedious to delete episodes from the feed. Why isn't there a batch delete, especially for unplayed episodes?  Even so it is still the best there is. Thanks!

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks Gwen! We love to help users get the most out of this app and pleased to know support was able to help with the playback issue. Regarding batch delete, request is noted and we may well add it; but meantime you can always batch-mark-as-played (long-press then hit played icon on top) which will delete the episodes under default settings.

author: Balmusico
comment: I originally gave this app a 5 star review. It has the best designed interface of any podcast app I have seen. But over time the server and synchronisation problems have got steadily worse, and although my bug reports get a response on an individual basis, the underlying problem doesn't seem to improve. Sad to say, it's time to move on :(

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Sorry to see you go Balmusico. As you can see from other reviews, we do work hard to ensure syncing is fine and run many automated tests and monitoring to ensure that. Nevertheless, things can go wrong on individual devices depending on connection, OS etc. Thanks for your encouragement anyway, good luck 👋

author: #1NewEnGlandR -
comment: Still early but at 150 mb or so I hope it's decent. Was gd for a while but then wasn't allowing me to get newest podcasts, kept getting errors. UNINSTALLING

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi - Just an update: Our team has confirmed the issue you mentioned here has been resolved. We appreciate you for bringing this to our attention, and hope to have you back to using our app soon. Cheers.

author: Noam Shelef
comment: I wish it would download all the episodes when they're available. I keep being frustrated that an episode posted hours ago is not actually downloaded when I am not on WiFi and want to listen to it. Customer support looked at my logs and said everything was working fine, but it simply is not.  (PS -- downgrading my review in light of the wrong-on-the-facts response to this review and the nonresponse over email. It doesn't work like they say it should. And the developers seem to be in denial).

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi Noam, I'm sorry we didn't respond to your mail immediately, we're a small team and try to respond to everyone, but as a user of an app that's free to you without ads, we can't always respond immediately. If you could let us know a specific incident, that would be appreciated as we run a lot of tests to ensure feeds are up to date.

author: Adam Crowe
comment: The app is great just wish that syncing to a computer was available on the free version. Also when a podcast is paused and I get a notification, the podcast starts playing randomly without my pressing play.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks Adam! Your subscriptions, starred topics and Play Later are synced even if you're on the free version. More data (e.g. play history, app settings) will be synced when you're on premium. Pls. feel free to go to Settings | Upgrade for more info. For your playback issue, pls. send logs in Settings | Help | Contact us so we can investigate it.

author: Cliff Daniel
comment: I have been experiencing a lot of playback issues lately. Episodes simply don't play. Then I will select another episode of the same show and it works. Completely arbitrary and annoying. Also...still have the widget issue that others have mentioned. I don't even get into the download issues...plenty of others have mentioned it

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Sorry for the issues you're having, Cliff. For your playback issues, does this occur to a specific podcast show? If so, please let us know its exact title so we can check. Please reply to us with your logs by going to Settings | Help | [Contact us]. Your logs will also help us investigate your other issues. We look forward to receiving them soon.

author: Matt Hornish
comment: I'd like to see an option to let me hide played episodes in the show list. I like to sort my lists by the oldest first and long running series require me to scroll down a lot when looking for the next unplayed episode.  Update: Thank you for the fast reply!  I completely overlooked the Show Played toggle.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks, Matt! You may hide played episodes by going to Settings and disabling [Show played]. Sorting episodes by oldest is also possible. Simply access a podcast show, tap on the gear icon, then set [Sort episodes] to [Oldest]. Feel free to email us at support@player.fm should you need further assistance or have suggestions for improvement.

author: Notorius Bigpappi
comment: My favourite podcast app, but just one thing...  When I connect my headphones a podcast starts playing even if I haven't opened the app. Is there an option to stop this?

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks Notorius! Please check Playback Settings, you probably have "headphone actions" set to "resume" but you can turn that off so playback won't happen when you connect them.

author: John Franson
comment: This served me well for a while, but pretty soon I wanted multiple playlists and this didn't have that -- you have to pay for that feature. Also, I had it set to download every hour, but it wasn't consistently updating my hourly news update feeds from NPR and BBC. So I switched to Podcast Republic, which has multiple playlists for free, and consistently downloads those two feeds every hour. However, I still recommend this app from Player FM as the best free podcast app if you don't need multiple playlists or hourly updates.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi John - Yes, the creation of multiple playlists is a paid feature. But when you become a premium member, you won't only enjoy that feature but many others too, e.g. space saver, simultaneous downloading, etc. Feeds should be updated based on your settings. We can further check this, but I see you've moved on. Thanks for your compliments, btw.

comment: Awesome selection and the best search function I've used in a podcast app. But the convoluted playlist/download system is frustrating and un-user friendly, there's a list of downloaded podcasts, a play later list, a history list and several more (really.) There's also endless ways to move/pin/mark as listened etc. it feels like 3 or 4 apps in one which isn't a good thing in this case.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks!Each playlist you mentioned has its unique uses,and it's intentional that some actions can be done in many ways.This is in order to address the concerns of users who use the app in ways that may be different to yours.As a suggestion,feel free to stick to what works best for you.You don't need to use them all if you don't feel the need to. :)

author: Eli Chalmer
comment: The other podcast player I was using was full of bugs and glitches and crashes. I switched to this one and it's way better. Does not crash, and is much faster and more responsive.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks for the compliment on our app, Eli!

author: Ellie Kennard
comment: I am now getting notified that Player FM is overloading the system (CPU) and needs to be closed. What's changed? Love the app and have used or for years but this is a new and worrying experience.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Hi Ellie, there could be a lot of factors as to why this happened but one thing we can assure you, the app did not change and it should not be using major CPU usage. It would help us check this if you can send a report via the app's Settings | Help | Contact Us and make sure to send logs.

author: Jonathan Pritchard-Barrett
comment: I love this app.i recently tried using the default one on my work iPhone and was sorely disappointed. The suggestions​ could be updated a bit more regularly, but there are quite a few of them - many more than Apple provide. The team have made useful updated over the years and now have a fantastic product.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thank you for your wonderful feedback and the 5-star rating, Jonathan! We'll also take note of your feedback for future updates. Cheers!

author: Michael Bilodeau
comment: This has been my podcast app of choice for years. It is so easy to use and now the features are everything I am looking for. I tried Stitcher and Castbox, both have severe issues that made me uninstall, even though my Mazda has Stitcher integrated.

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: Thanks for the continued support on Player FM, Michael! We're so happy to know our app works well for you, and that you find it complete and easy to use.

author: Lawrence Hammer
comment: great app so far, I've had it for a week and it is the first one to have all of the podcast that I listen to. work seamlessly and pauses for navigation so I never miss anything. Great app

reply.author: Player FM Podcasts
reply.content: We're delighted to know Player FM has all your favorite podcasts, and that the app works well for you. Thanks much, Lawrence!
